text: What else does anxiety about the future bring you but sorrow upon sorrow?
author: Thomas Kempis

text: First keep the peace within yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Intelligence must follow faith, never precede it, and never destroy it.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: In judging of others, a man laboreth in vain, often erreth and easily sinneth; but in judging and examining himself, he always laboreth fruitfully.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Purity and simplicity are the two wings with which man soars above the earth and all temporary nature.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Watch for good times to retreat into yourself. Frequently meditate on how good God is to you.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Nothing is sweeter than love, nothing stronger, nothing higher, nothing wider, nothing more pleasant, nothing fuller or better in heaven or earth; for love is born of God.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Without labor there is no rest, nor without fighting can the victory be won.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: How sweet it is to love, and to be dissolved, and as it were to bathe myself in thy love.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: The reflections on a day well spent furnish us with joys more pleasing than ten thousand triumphs.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Nothing is sweeter than love, nothing higher, nothing stronger, nothing larger, nothing more joyful, nothing fuller, and nothing better in heaven or on earth.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: When a man is out of sight, it is not too long before he is out of mind.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: The only safe ruler is he who has learned to obey willingly.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Who has a harder fight than he who is striving to overcome himself.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: If you wish to stand and progress as you ought, hold yourself an exile and a pilgrim on the earth.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Learn to humble yourself, you are but earth and clay.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: The acknowledgment of our weakness is the first step in repairing our loss.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Bear the Cross cheerfully and it will bear you.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: If you carry your cross joyfully, it will carry you.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Remember that lost time does not return.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Remember always your end, and that lost time does not return.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: If you desire to know or learn anything to your advantage, then take delight in being unknown and unregarded. A true understanding and humble estimate of oneself is the highest and most valuable of all lessons.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: All perfection in this life is attended by some imperfection, and all our farseeing is not without obscurity.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: We should have great peace if we did not busy ourselves with what others say and do.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Who has a harder fight than he who is striving to overcome self?
author: Thomas Kempis

text: We are sometimes stirred by emotion and take it for zeal.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Do not concern yourself with anxiety for the show of a great name.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: It is vanity to desire a long life and to take no heed of a good life.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Often I am not where I am, but where my thoughts lead me.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: It is much safer to obey than to rule.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: Today the man is here; tomorrow he is gone. And when he is 'out of sight', quickly also is he out of mind.
author: Thomas Kempis

text: There is no man in this world without some manner of tribulation or anguish, though he be king or pope.
author: Thomas Kempis
